section.title: Audio System (aud)
section.paragraph: Audaspace (pronounced “outer space”) is a high level audio library.

section.title: Basic Sound Playback
section.paragraph: This script shows how to use the classes: Device, Factory and Handle.
section.literal_block:
import aud
device = aud.device() # load sound file (it can be a video file with audio) factory = aud.Factory('music.ogg')
# play the audio, this return a handle to control play/pause handle = device.play(factory) # if the audio is not too big and will be used often you can buffer it factory_buffered = aud.Factory.buffer(factory) handle_buffered = device.play(factory_buffered)
# stop the sounds (otherwise they play until their ends) handle.stop() handle_buffered.stop()

desc_content.paragraph: Device objects represent an audio output backend like OpenAL or SDL, but might also represent a file output or RAM buffer output.
Locks the device so that it’s guaranteed, that no samples are read from the streams until unlock() is called. This is useful if you want to do start/stop/pause/resume some sounds at the same time.

note.paragraph: The device has to be unlocked as often as locked to be able to continue playback.

warning.paragraph: Make sure the time between locking and unlocking is as short as possible to avoid clicks.

list_item.paragraph: sound (Sound) – The sound to play.
keep (bool) – See Handle.keep.

field_body.paragraph: The playback handle with which playback can be controlled with.

desc_content.paragraph: Stops all playing and paused sounds.
Unlocks the device after a lock call, see lock() for details.
The channel count of the device.
The distance model of the device.
The doppler factor of the device. This factor is a scaling factor for the velocity vectors in doppler calculation. So a value bigger than 1 will exaggerate the effect as it raises the velocity.
The native sample format of the device.
The listeners’s location in 3D space, a 3D tuple of floats.
The listener’s orientation in 3D space as quaternion, a 4 float tuple.
The listener’s velocity in 3D space, a 3D tuple of floats.
The sampling rate of the device in Hz.
The speed of sound of the device. The speed of sound in air is typically 343.3 m/s.
The overall volume of the device.

The DynamicMusic object allows to play music depending on a current scene, scene changes are managed by the class, with the possibility of custom transitions. The default transition is a crossfade effect, and the default scene is silent and has id 0

list_item.paragraph: ini (int) – the initial scene foor the transition.
end (int) – The final scene for the transition.
transition (Sound) – The transition sound.

field_body.paragraph: false if the ini or end scenes don’t exist, true othrwise.

desc_content.paragraph: The length in seconds of the crossfade transition
The playback position of the scene in seconds.
Whether the scene is playing, paused or stopped (=invalid).
Handle objects are playback handles that can be used to control playback of a sound. If a sound is played back multiple times then there are as many handles.
This factor is used for distance based attenuation of the source.

The opening angle of the inner cone of the source. If the cone values of a source are set there are two (audible) cones with the apex at the location of the source and with infinite height, heading in the direction of the source’s orientation. In the inner cone the volume is normal. Outside the outer cone the volume will be cone_volume_outer and in the area between the volume will be interpolated linearly.
The opening angle of the outer cone of the source.
The volume outside the outer cone of the source.
The maximum distance of the source. If the listener is further away the source volume will be 0.
The reference distance of the source. At this distance the volume will be exactly volume.
Whether the sound should be kept paused in the device when its end is reached. This can be used to seek the sound to some position and start playback again.

warning.paragraph: If this is set to true and you forget stopping this equals a memory leak as the handle exists until the device is destroyed.

desc_content.paragraph: The source’s location in 3D space, a 3D tuple of floats.
The (remaining) loop count of the sound. A negative value indicates infinity.
The source’s orientation in 3D space as quaternion, a 4 float tuple.
The playback position of the sound in seconds.
Whether the source’s location, velocity and orientation is relative or absolute to the listener.
Whether the sound is playing, paused or stopped (=invalid).
The source’s velocity in 3D space, a 3D tuple of floats.
The maximum volume of the source.
The minimum volume of the source.
A PlabackManager object allows to easily control groups os sounds organized in categories.
Adds a category with a custom volume.

field_body.paragraph: volume (float) – The volume for ther new category.
The key of the new category.

desc_content.paragraph: Cleans all the invalid and finished sound from the playback manager.
Retrieves the volume of a category.

field_body.paragraph: catKey (int) – the key of the category.
catKey (int) – the key of the category.

desc_content.paragraph: Plays a sound through the playback manager and assigns it to a category.

list_item.paragraph: sound (Sound) – The sound to play.
catKey (int) – the key of the category in which the sound will be added, if it doesn’t exist, a new one will be created.

field_body.paragraph: The playback handle with which playback can be controlled with.
catKey (int) – the key of the category.

desc_content.paragraph: Changes the volume of a category.

list_item.paragraph: volume (float) – the new volume value.
catKey (int) – the key of the category.

field_body.paragraph: catKey (int) – the key of the category.

desc_content.paragraph: This sound represents sequenced entries to play a sound scene.

Adds a new entry to the scene. :arg sound: The sound this entry should play. :type sound: Sound :arg begin: The start time. :type begin: float :arg end: The end time or a negative value if determined by the sound. :type end: float :arg skip: How much seconds should be skipped at the beginning. :type skip: float :return: The entry added. :rtype: SequenceEntry
Adds a new entry to the scene. :arg entry: The entry to remove. :type entry: SequenceEntry
Writes animation data to a sequence.

list_item.paragraph: type (int) – The type of animation data.
frame (int) – The frame this data is for.
data (sequence of float) – The data to write.
animated (bool) – Whether the attribute is animated.

desc_content.paragraph: The channel count of the sequence.
The distance model of the sequence.
The doppler factor of the sequence. This factor is a scaling factor for the velocity vectors in doppler calculation. So a value bigger than 1 will exaggerate the effect as it raises the velocity.
The listeners’s location in 3D space, a 3D tuple of floats.
Whether the whole sequence is muted.
The sampling rate of the sequence in Hz.
The speed of sound of the sequence. The speed of sound in air is typically 343.3 m/s.
SequenceEntry objects represent an entry of a sequenced sound.

list_item.paragraph: begin (float) – The new start time.
end (float) – The new end time or a negative value if unknown.
skip (float) – How many seconds to skip at the beginning.

desc_content.paragraph: Writes animation data to a sequenced entry.

list_item.paragraph: type (int) – The type of animation data.
frame (int) – The frame this data is for.
data (sequence of float) – The data to write.
animated (bool) – Whether the attribute is animated.

desc_content.paragraph: This factor is used for distance based attenuation of the source.

The opening angle of the inner cone of the source. If the cone values of a source are set there are two (audible) cones with the apex at the location of the source and with infinite height, heading in the direction of the source’s orientation. In the inner cone the volume is normal. Outside the outer cone the volume will be cone_volume_outer and in the area between the volume will be interpolated linearly.
The opening angle of the outer cone of the source.
The volume outside the outer cone of the source.
The maximum distance of the source. If the listener is further away the source volume will be 0.
The reference distance of the source. At this distance the volume will be exactly volume.
Whether the source’s location, velocity and orientation is relative or absolute to the listener.
The sound the entry is representing and will be played in the sequence.
The maximum volume of the source.
The minimum volume of the source.
Sound objects are immutable and represent a sound that can be played simultaneously multiple times. They are called factories because they create reader objects internally that are used for playback.
Creates a sound from a data buffer.

list_item.paragraph: data (numpy.ndarray) – The data as two dimensional numpy array.
rate (double) – The sample rate.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a sound object of a sound file.

warning.paragraph: If the file doesn’t exist or can’t be read you will not get an exception immediately, but when you try to start playback of that sound.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates an empty sound list that can contain several sounds.

field_body.paragraph: random (int) – wether the playback will be random or not.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a sawtooth sound which plays a sawtooth wave.

list_item.paragraph: frequency (float) – The frequency of the sawtooth wave in Hz.
rate (int) – The sampling rate in Hz. It’s recommended to set this value to the playback device’s samling rate to avoid resamping.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a silence sound which plays simple silence.
Creates a sine sound which plays a sine wave.

list_item.paragraph: frequency (float) – The frequency of the sine wave in Hz.
rate (int) – The sampling rate in Hz. It’s recommended to set this value to the playback device’s samling rate to avoid resamping.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a square sound which plays a square wave.

list_item.paragraph: frequency (float) – The frequency of the square wave in Hz.
rate (int) – The sampling rate in Hz. It’s recommended to set this value to the playback device’s samling rate to avoid resamping.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a triangle sound which plays a triangle wave.

list_item.paragraph: frequency (float) – The frequency of the triangle wave in Hz.
rate (int) – The sampling rate in Hz. It’s recommended to set this value to the playback device’s samling rate to avoid resamping.

desc_content.paragraph: Attack-Decay-Sustain-Release envelopes the volume of a sound. Note: there is currently no way to trigger the release with this API.

list_item.paragraph: attack (float) – The attack time in seconds.
decay (float) – The decay time in seconds.
sustain (float) – The sustain level.
release (float) – The release level.

desc_content.paragraph: Accumulates a sound by summing over positive input differences thus generating a monotonic sigal. If additivity is set to true negative input differences get added too, but positive ones with a factor of two. Note that with additivity the signal is not monotonic anymore.

field_body.paragraph: additive – Whether the accumulation should be additive or not.

desc_content.paragraph: Adds a new sound to a sound list.

field_body.paragraph: sound (Sound) – The sound that will be added to the list.

note.paragraph: You can only add a sound to a sound list.

desc_content.paragraph: Caches a sound into RAM. This saves CPU usage needed for decoding and file access if the underlying sound reads from a file on the harddisk, but it consumes a lot of memory.

note.paragraph: Only known-length factories can be buffered.

warning.paragraph: Raw PCM data needs a lot of space, only buffer short factories.

desc_content.paragraph: Retrieves the data of the sound as numpy array.

field_body.paragraph: A two dimensional numpy float array.

desc_content.paragraph: Delays by playing adding silence in front of the other sound’s data.

field_body.paragraph: time (float) – How many seconds of silence should be added before the sound.

desc_content.paragraph: Delays by playing adding silence in front of the other sound’s data.

list_item.paragraph: attack (float) – The attack factor.
release (float) – The release factor.
threshold (float) – The general threshold value.
arthreshold (float) – The attack/release threshold value.

desc_content.paragraph: Fades a sound in by raising the volume linearly in the given time interval.

list_item.paragraph: start (float) – Time in seconds when the fading should start.
length (float) – Time in seconds how long the fading should last.

note.paragraph: Before the fade starts it plays silence.

desc_content.paragraph: Fades a sound in by lowering the volume linearly in the given time interval.

list_item.paragraph: start (float) – Time in seconds when the fading should start.
length (float) – Time in seconds how long the fading should last.

note.paragraph: After the fade this sound plays silence, so that the length of the sound is not altered.

desc_content.paragraph: Filters a sound with the supplied IIR filter coefficients. Without the second parameter you’ll get a FIR filter. If the first value of the a sequence is 0 it will be set to 1 automatically. If the first value of the a sequence is neither 0 nor 1, all filter coefficients will be scaled by this value so that it is 1 in the end, you don’t have to scale yourself.

list_item.paragraph: b (sequence of float) – The nominator filter coefficients.
a (sequence of float) – The denominator filter coefficients.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a second order highpass filter based on the transfer function H(s) = s^2 / (s^2 + s/Q + 1)

list_item.paragraph: frequency (float) – The cut off trequency of the highpass.
Q (float) – Q factor of the lowpass.

field_body.paragraph: sound (Sound) – The sound to play second.

note.paragraph: The two factories have to have the same specifications (channels and samplerate).

desc_content.paragraph: Limits a sound within a specific start and end time.

list_item.paragraph: start (float) – Start time in seconds.
end (float) – End time in seconds.

field_body.paragraph: count (integer) – How often the sound should be looped. Negative values mean endlessly.

note.paragraph: This is a filter function, you might consider using Handle.loop_count instead.

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a second order lowpass filter based on the transfer function H(s) = 1 / (s^2 + s/Q + 1)

list_item.paragraph: frequency (float) – The cut off trequency of the lowpass.
Q (float) – Q factor of the lowpass.

field_body.paragraph: sound (Sound) – The sound to mix over the other.

note.paragraph: The two factories have to have the same specifications (channels and samplerate).

desc_content.paragraph: Creates a sound that will be restarted when sought backwards. If the original sound is a sound list, the playing sound can change.
Plays a sound forward and then backward. This is like joining a sound with its reverse.
Changes the pitch of a sound with a specific factor.

field_body.paragraph: factor (float) – The factor to change the pitch with.

note.paragraph: This is done by changing the sample rate of the underlying sound, which has to be an integer, so the factor value rounded and the factor may not be 100 % accurate.
This is a filter function, you might consider using Handle.pitch instead.

list_item.paragraph: rate (double) – The new sample rate.
high_quality (bool) – When true use a higher quality but slower resampler.

note.paragraph: The sound has to have a finite length and has to be seekable. It’s recommended to use this only with factories with fast and accurate seeking, which is not true for encoded audio files, such ones should be buffered using cache() before being played reversed.

warning.paragraph: If seeking is not accurate in the underlying sound you’ll likely hear skips/jumps/cracks.

desc_content.paragraph: Sums the samples of a sound.
Makes a threshold wave out of an audio wave by setting all samples with a amplitude >= threshold to 1, all <= -threshold to -1 and all between to 0.

field_body.paragraph: threshold (float) – Threshold value over which an amplitude counts non-zero.

desc_content.paragraph: Changes the volume of a sound.

note.paragraph: Should be in the range [0, 1] to avoid clipping.
This is a filter function, you might consider using Handle.volume instead.

desc_content.paragraph: write(filename, rate, channels, format, container, codec, bitrate, buffersize)
Writes the sound to a file.

list_item.paragraph: filename (string) – The path to write to.
rate (int) – The sample rate to write with.
channels (int) – The number of channels to write with.
format (int) – The sample format to write with.
container (int) – The container format for the file.
codec (int) – The codec to use in the file.
bitrate (int) – The bitrate to write with.
buffersize (int) – The size of the writing buffer.

desc_content.paragraph: The sample specification of the sound as a tuple with rate and channel count.
The sample specification of the sound as a tuple with rate and channel count.
The source object represents the source position of a binaural sound.
The distance value. 0 is min, 1 is max.
A ThreadPool is used to parallelize convolution efficiently.
